docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: UNTIL a little more than a month ago, the marquee of the Victory Theater on West 42d Street announced double features with titles like ''Hot Saddle Tramp'' and ''Fantasex Girls.'' It was a sad time for the oldest existing theatrical house in Times Square, a theater between Seventh and Eighth Avenues that was built by the stage impresario Oscar

headline.main: A New Show In and About A Theater With a Past

docs.snippet: LEAD: ''Driving Miss Daisy'' came away today with nine Oscar nominations, the largest number for any film this year. The low-budget movie adaptation of Alfred Uhry's Pulitzer Prize-winning stage play about changing social mores in the post-World W...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: ''Driving Miss Daisy'' came away today with nine Oscar nominations, the largest number for any film this year. The low-budget movie adaptation of Alfred Uhry's Pulitzer Prize-winning stage play about changing social mores in the post-World War II South was made by the Zanuck Company, a fledgling production concern.

headline.main: 'Miss Daisy' Leads On the Oscars Ballot In a Year of the Small

docs.snippet: LEAD: One of the highlights of public television's current Black History Month schedule is tonight's ''American Playhouse'' presentation of ''Zora Is My Name!'' That defiant exclamation point is significant. Zora Neale Hurston, the black writer an...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: One of the highlights of public television's current Black History Month schedule is tonight's ''American Playhouse'' presentation of ''Zora Is My Name!'' That defiant exclamation point is significant. Zora Neale Hurston, the black writer and folklorist, was a fierce advocate of black pride back in the 1930's and 40's, long before the nation was being pointedly told that black is beautiful.

headline.main: Review/Television;   A Folklorist Who Insisted on Black Pride

docs.snippet: LEAD: The American Jewish Committee, widely regarded as the dean of Jewish organizations in the United States, plans a major restructuring that it hopes will give the group a sharper focus and reduce its costs....
